title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Wednesday, 4 November 2015 - BBC News
summary: a woman has received serious injuries after she was hit by a lorry as a fair was being set up at midsummer common in cambridge .
organisers are meeting to discuss whether tomorrow 's bonfire night celebrations should go ahead following the accident .
the health and safety executive is to investigate .
we 'll be back with more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: goodnight from the cambridgeshire live team .
we 'll be back again on thursday from 08:00 for the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
you can send us your stories , and comments at any time .
send them to us via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your pictures : mist rising at the whittlesey washes
text: the we 're using at the top of our page today shows a misty sunset on the whittlesey washes , taken by andrew walpole .
we 'd love to see your photos of cambridgeshire .
you can send them via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a cloudy but dry night , minimum temperature 9c ( 48f )
text: it will be staying rather cloudy tonight but mainly dry , with some outbreaks of patchy rain likely during the early hours .
minimum temperature 9c ( 48f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live , head to bbc weather .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: volunteers wanted to count swans on the ouse washes
text: volunteers are needed to help collect data from the thousands of whooper and bewick 's swans wintering on the ouse washes .
staff at the wildfowl and wetland trust at welney will train them how to identify the different species of swan , how to count the flocks and read ring numbers of individual birds .
you can see a lot more swans on autumnwatch .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: midsummer common lorry accident : what we know so far
text: bonfire night preparations on midsummer common in cambridge have been halted after a woman was seriously injured .
here 's a recap :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man arrested after 15 migrants were discovered in a lorry is released by police
text: a bulgarian man arrested after 15 migrants were discovered in the back of a lorry in fordham has been released with no further action .
police found 15 suspected illegal immigrants in the back of a refrigerated lorry after reports of `` banging '' coming from inside it .
the men were discovered at a depot belonging to turners of soham , in fordham , just before 07:00 yesterday .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: city council on lorry crash : 'our thoughts are with the member of the public concerned '
text: cambridge city council says its `` thoughts are with the member of the public concerned , '' following the accident on midsummer common earlier .
the council have issued a statement following an incident on midsummer common earlier today
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lorry crash victim has 'serious leg and abdominal ' injuries
text: the latest from east of england ambulance service is that the victim , a woman in her 30s , has `` serious leg and abdominal '' injuries .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: midsummer common crash : health and safety executive to investigate
text: the health and safety executive will be investigating the accident involving a woman and a lorry involved in setting up the bonfire night fair on midsummer common .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: watch : the scene at midsummer common after the lorry accident
text: this is the scene on midsummer common as organisers meet to decide whether to go ahead with the bonfire night celebrations following the lorry accident earlier .
midsummer common in cambridge where a woman was seriously hurt earlier today

documents.title: bonfire organisers meeting shortly to discuss whether to continue with event
text: organisers of the cambridge bonfire night celebrations are meeting shortly to decide whether to go ahead with the event following this afternoon 's accident .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: midsummer common lorry accident : woman 'was stationary when hit '
text: i 've been told by cambridge city council , organisers of tomorrow 's bonfire night event , that the woman who suffered serious leg injuries on midsummer common had a bike , but was stationary when she was hit by a lorry .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: bonfire celebrations works remain on hold following lorry accident
text: preparations for cambridge 's bonfire night celebrations remain on hold after a woman was hit by a lorry and suffered serious leg injuries .
about 25,000 people are expected at the event tomorrow , held annually on midsummer common in central cambridge .

documents.title: picture : scene of the lorry accident on midsummer common
text: this is the scene of the accident on midsummer common where a woman was seriously injured by a lorry involved with the bonfire night fair .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: midsummer common lorry accident : statement from council chief excutive
text: antoinette jackson , chief executive of cambridge city councill , has issued the following statement about the lorry accident on midsummer common :
`` the matter is currently being managed by the emergency services and we are awaiting further information from them . ''

documents.title: midsummer common lorry accident : what we know so far
text: bonfire night preparations on midsummer common in cambridge have been halted after a woman was seriously injured .
here 's what we know so far :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: midsummer common lorry accident : latest from ambulance service
text: east of england ambulance service was called to midsummer common in cambridge at 12:16 following reports a member of the public was `` under a lorry ''
an ambulance and a rapid response vehicle attended , along with a team from magpas the emergency response charity .
one woman in her 30s was taken to addenbrooke 's hospital with serious leg injuries .

documents.title: midsummer common lorry accident : reporter en route
text: i 'm on my way to cambridge 's midsummer common where a woman has suffered serious injuries after being hit by a lorry .
i 'll bring you updates from the scene shortly .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: breakingbonfire night preparations halted after woman is seriously injured
text: work on cambridge 's bonfire night celebrations , on midsummer common , have been temporarily halted after a woman sustained `` serious leg injuries '' in an accident involving a lorry .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cambridge lorry accident : more from bonfire organisers
text: cambridge live trust 's statement continues : `` the matter is currently in the hands of the police and emergency services and we are awaiting further information from them .
`` we take the safety of members of the public very seriously at all our events and we will be working with the police and all involved to understand how this happened .
`` our thoughts are with the member of the public concerned . ''

documents.title: cambridge lorry accident : bonfire celebration organisers issue statement
text: cambridge live trust , the organisers of bonfire celebrations at midsummer common , where a woman was injured in a lorry accident , has just issued this statement :
`` we understand that an incident has occurred on midsummer common involving a member of the public and a vehicle relating to the funfair for cambridge 's bonfire night .
`` the funfair is operated by stanley thurston who have years of experience in the running of fairs in public spaces , including many years on midsummer common . ''

documents.title: lorry accident happened at fairgound site
text: the lorry accident at midsummer common in camrbridge happened during work to set up a fair ahead of tomorrow 's bonfire night celebration .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: woman her 30s receives serious leg injuries 'underneath a lorry '
text: a woman in her 30s receives serious leg injuries underneath a lorry '' on midsummer common in cambridge , says east of england ambulance service .
we 'll bring you more as we have it .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: breakingwoman injured by lorry on midsummer common in cambridge
text: a woman has suffered serious leg injuries after being hit by a lorry on midsummer common in cambridge .
more updates to follow .

documents.title: weather watchers project launched in cambridgeshire
text: a bbc project recruiting members of the public as weather watchers is launched today .
people in cambridgeshire are encouraged to join a uk-wide conversation about the weather .

you can sign up and add your home location on the weather watchers map , give precise information and upload it will provide an incredibly detailed up-to-date map of exactly what the weather is doing now - all over the country .
author: Emma Borley
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: crown court system intimidating and archaic - report
text: victims and witnesses are being marginalised during crown court trials and proceedings are often `` archaic '' and `` chaotic '' , a new study suggests .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: two residential special schools in county 'no longer viable '
text: two residential special schools facing closure are no longer viable because they only have 18 pupils , says the disability charity scope .
families of children using meldreth manor and orchard manor have called on the prime minister to intervene .
john maclachlan , regional director for scope , says the schools are operating at a loss and may have to close next spring .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cambridge hit with more parking tickets than peterborough
text: police handed out almost three times as many parking tickets in cambridge than in peterborough last year to vehicles causing obstructions .
figures obtained by bbc radio cambridgeshire show 329 vehicles were ticketed in cambridge between april 2014 and march this year - while 109 were issued in peterborough .
cambridgeshire 's police and crime commissioner sir graham bright says pavement parking is endangering people with pushchairs and the elderly in the county .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : a rainy afternoon , top temperature : 13c ( 55f )
text: rain may be heavy in places , but should slowly clear from the southwest during the afternoon .
the maximum temperature will be 13c ( 55f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live , head to bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: peterborough man killed in microlight crash in northamptonshire
text: an elderly man from sutton near peterborough has been killed after the microlight he was flying crashed in northamptonshire .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: firefighters practise large animal rescue training
text: officers from cambridgeshire fire and rescue have been practising their large animal rescue skills with this life-size dummy horse .
in august the service received an award for rescuing a donkey from a storm drain .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : plans to outsource foster care in peterborough revealed by council families will be left in 'turmoil ' if special schools close
text: here are the the main stories so far this morning :
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather watchers : get involved
text: weather watchers is now open for you to sign up and join in the conversation with people across the uk to help tell the story of the great british weather .
here 's an explanation of how it works :
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: cyclist sustains life-threatening injuries in cambridge
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a cyclist sustained life-threatening injuries in cambridge yesterday .
the man , in his 60s , was involved in a collision with a motorbike at 16:50 at the junction of mill road and cockburn street .
the rider of the motorbike , a man in his 30s , was uninjured .
anyone who saw the incident is asked to call 101 .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: gymnastics : coach 'sceptical ' about louis smith 's comeback
text: cambridgeshire gymnast louis smith 's coach admits he was initially ' '' sceptical '' that the 26-year-old could return to the top of the sport .
the three-time olympic medallist won double silver at last week 's world championships in glasgow , as great britain secured a record-breaking haul of medals .
paul smith from huntingdon gym told bbc radio cambridgeshire smith had `` worked extremely hard this year '' .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: arsonist who went missing after breaking peterborough temporary prison licence located
text: police have this morning arrested a hollesley bay prisoner who breached the conditions of a temporary release licence to peterborough .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: families will be 'left in turmoil ' by closure of special schools
text: the closure of two residential specialist schools would `` leave families in turmoil , '' according to the conservative mp for south cambridgeshire , heidi allen (
meldreth manor and orchard manor are run by the disability charity scope , which says that with only 18 pupils they are no longer financially viable .

documents.title: football : peterborough 's jon taylor nominated for award
text: peterborough united winger jon taylor has been nominated for the league one player of the month award for october .
taylor scored three goals in six appearances during the month , and will be up against adam armstrong ( coventry city ) , reece burke ( bradford city ) and aiden o'brien ( millwall ) .
the winner will be announced on friday morning .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: plans to outsource foster care could save £ 1m , says council
text: foster care in peterborough could be outsourced to save £ 1m under proposals by the city council .
wendi ogle-welbourn , the council 's corporate director of people and communities , says any partner agency would have to be not-for-profit .
currently the council spends £ 4m on specialist independent foster agencies , which deal with children who have more complex behavioural issues .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: lives put at risk by 'horrendously dangerous ' pavement parking
text: cambridgeshire 's police and crime commissioner , sir graham bright , says people with pushchairs and the elderly are being put at risk by `` horrendously dangerous '' pavement parking .
figures obtained by bbc radio cambridgeshire reveal 329 vehicles were ticketed in cambridge between april 2014 and march this year - the majority for causing obstructions .
we 'd like to know if it is a problem where you live .
have your say via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: homophobia row clergyman 'forced to quit hmp littlehey '
text: a prison minister at hmp littlehey felt `` compelled '' to resign after a row about `` homophobic '' bible verses which he read from during services for inmates .
the reverend barry trayhorn told an employment tribunal he had read the verses at the jail last year .
he was told complaints were made by gay prisoners and alleges he was unfairly dismissed .
his case against the secretary of state for justice continues .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: is cambridge running out of water ? fears the cam and its tributaries are at risk as population soars
text: cambridge 's famed waterways are edging towards crisis point as the city 's growth puts an unsustainable demand on the area 's natural water supply , it is claimed .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: families call for pm 's intervention over planned closure of special schools
text: families of children using two residential special schools in the county have called on the prime minister to intervene , handing in a 7,000-name petition to 10 downing street .
meldreth manor and orchard manor are run by the disability charity scope , which says they 're operating at a loss and may have to close next spring .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: partnership plans for peterborough city council fostering and adoption service
text: adoption and fostering services in peterborough could be put out to private companies in an effort to improve the service and save money .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: weather : a cloudy and misty start , top temperature 13c ( 55f )
text: a cloudy and misty start , with some showery rain .
heavy in places .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live , head to bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to cambridgeshire live
text: hello and welcome to cambridgeshire live for wednesday , where we 'll be bringing you live news , sport , travel and weather updates until 18:00 .
you can send us your stories , and comments at any time via email , facebook or twitter .
news and weather updates for this morning coming up shortly .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live
